title: Sandwich Bread - Classic White
text:
Yield 1 large loaf
Total Time 5 hr

Step A | Prep 15 min
Step B | Cover & Let Rise 1 hr 10 min
Step C | Shape & Let Rise 1 hr
Step D | Bake 35 min
Step E | Cool 2 hr


adapted from: kingarthurbaking.com

title: Sandwich Bread - Classic White
text:
Yield 1 large loaf
Total Time 5 hr

Step A | Prep 15 min
Step B | Cover & Let Rise 1 hr 10 min
Step C | Shape & Let Rise 1 hr
Step D | Bake 35 min
Step E | Cool 2 hr


adapted from: kingarthurbaking.com

title: Sandwich Bread - Classic White
text:
Materials








item
#metric
#imperial




water1, lukewarm
320 g
-


honey
32 g
-


instant yeast
8 g
-


salt
11 g
-


butter, softened
28 g
2 Tbsp


all-purpose flour2
480 g
-


powdered milk
37 g
-



1 lesser amount in summer/humid climates, greater amount in winter/drier climates.2 alt 200 g wheat flour, the rest ap flour

title: Sandwich Bread - Classic White
text:
Process

Step A | Prep

Add to stand mixer bowl, in order

water, lukewarm
honey
instant yeast
salt
butter, softened
flour
powdered milk

Hand mix for a bit to get things less powdery
Mix with dough hook on speed 2 for ~5 min3

ingredients will ball, then get goopy looking, then will pull off the sides and ball again
done when passes the windowpane test

Single-hand the sticky dough ball and scrape clean bowl as able with alt hand

lightly lube bowl with oil, rub around with alt hand
pull the dough ball into a tight ball with both hands
place dough ball in bowl seam side down


3 UPDATE ME! time this and update the recipe

Step B | Cover & Let Rise

Cover dough bowl and let rise for 70 min4

should be puffy
not quite doubled in size


4 60 - 90 min depending on room temp

Step C | Shape & Let Rise

Deflate dough and shape into log to fit loaf pan.
Place dough log into lightly lubed loaf pan
Let rise 60 min5

slice a line down the center of log before placing in oven


5 60 - 90 min depending on room temp

Step D | Bake

Bake for 20 min at 350 F
Loosely tent with foil, bake for an additional 15 - 20 min at 350 F

thermometer at center should read 195 - 200 F




Step E | Cool

Remove from oven, remove from loaf pan
Cool on rack for 2 hr

title: Sandwich Bread - Classic White

title: Lime Tofu
text: gf gluten-free

title: Lime Tofu
text:
About
Yield 4 servies
Total Time 1 hr

Step A | Pickle 5 min
Step B | Fry Tofu 20 min
Step C | Prepare Sauce 25 min
Step D | Combine 10 min


adapted from: Ottolenghi Flavor

title: Lime Tofu
text:
Materials

Pickled Onions








item
#metric
#imperial




apple cider vinegar
-
1 Tbsp


sugar
-
1 tsp


red onion1, sliced
60g
1/2 c


salt
-
1/8 tsp



1 small onion with rounds from a mandoline

Tofu








item
#metric
#imperial




sunflower oil
600 ml
2-1/2 c


extra firm tofu, cubed 2
560 g
1 lb 4 oz


corn starch
-
2 Tbsp



2 around 2 blocks, dry and 3/4” cubes

Sauce



item
#metric
#imperial




yellow onion, rough chop
300 g
10-1/2 oz


garlic clove, rough chop
6
6


olive oil
60 ml
1/4 c


cumin seed, rough crush
-
2 tsp


lime juice
-
1 Tbsp


lime zest
-
1 Tbsp


tomato paste
-
2 Tbsp


water
400 ml
1-2/3 c


sugar
-
1 tsp


salt
-
1-1/4 tsp


black pepper
-
-


parsley, rough chop
20 g
1 c


baby spinach
250 g
6 c

title: Lime Tofu
text:
Process

Step A | Pickle

To a small bowl add

apple cider vinegar
sugar
red onion, sliced
salt

Mix well to combine

set aside to pickle




Step B | Fry Tofu

Heat sunflower oil in a pan over medium-high heat
Toss the extra firm tofu in a bowl with the corn starch until well coated
Fry the coated tofu in two batches until crispy and lightly browned, about 6 min per batch

transfer to a plate lined with paper towels
set aside




Step C | Prepare Sauce

To a food processor add rough chopped yellow onion and garlic clove

pulse food processor until very finely minced but not puréed

Heat olive oil in a pan over over medium-high heat
Add the minced onion mixture and cook until softened and lightly browned, about 10 min

stir occasionally

Add to the pan

cumin seed
lime juice
lime zest
tomato paste

Cook for 1 min before adding to the pan

water
sugar
salt
black pepper

Bring to a simmer and cook 6 min until thick and rich

stir occasionally




Step D | Combine

Add crispy tofu, parsley, and black pepper to the pan


stir to combine and coat


Add the baby spinach in increments, stirring about 3 min until just wilted
Top with pickled red onions

title: Lime Tofu

title: Jollof Rice
text:
About
Yield update me
Total Time 1 hr

Step A | Prep Tomato Sauce 15 min
Step B | Cook Rice 30 min
Step C | Rest 15 min


adapted from: Chef John (allrecipes.com)

title: Jollof Rice
text:
Materials

Tomato Sauce



item
#metric
#imperial




tomato, cored and quartered
1
1


red bell pepper, rough chopped
1
1


habanero, whole
1
1


fresno or jalapeno, whole
1
1


garlic clove, peeled
4
4


ginger, minced
-
1 Tbsp


water
-
2 c





Rice



item
#metric
#imperial




olive oil
-
1/3 c


red onion, diced
1
1


salt
-
1 tsp


tomato paste
-
1/4 c


smoked paprika
-
2 Tbsp


curry powder
-
1 tsp


cumin
-
1 tsp


dried thyme
-
1 tsp


black pepper
-
1/2 tsp


tumeric
-
1/4 tsp


basmati rice
-
2-1/4 c


bay leaf
1
1


chicken bouillon paste
-
1 Tbsp


green onion, chopped
-
1/4 c


cilantro, chopped
-
1/4 c

title: Jollof Rice
text:
Process

Step A | Prep Tomato Sauce

Add to a blender

tomato, cored and quartered
red bell pepper, rough chopped
habanero, whole
fresno/jalapeno, whole
garlic clove, peeled
ginger, minced
water

Blend on high until smooth



Step B | Cook Rice

Heat olive oil in a saucepan over medium heat
Add diced red onion & salt to saucepan

saute until onions start to soften, 4 - 5 min

Cleared middle of the saucepan and add tomato paste

saute for 2 - 3 min

Season saucepan with

smoked paprika
curry powder
cumin
dried thyme
black pepper
tumeric

Cook an additional 1 - 2 min until everything is well-combined
Turn off the heat to saucepan

stir in basmati rice, evenly coating all grains
add bay leaf & chicken bouillon paste

Turn saucepan heat to high

stir in blended Tomato Sauce
bring to a vigorous simmer

Cover saucepan with tight lid

reduce heat to medium-low
simmer for 20 minutes without removing the lid or stirring




Step C | Rest

After 20 min, turn off the heat

set timer for 12 min
allow rice to sit, do not remove lid

After 12 min, remove lid from saucepan

fluff rice with a fork, separating all grains
garnish with chopped green onion & cilantro

title: Jollof Rice

title: Mayo
text: gf gluten-free

title: Mayo
text:
About
Yield 1 cup
Total Time 7 min
Note refrigerate in an airtight container for up to 2 weeks

Step A | Prep 5 min
Step B | Blend 1 min
Step C | Season 1 min


adapted from: https://www.seriouseats.com/two-minute-mayonnaise

title: Mayo
text:
Materials



item
#metric
#imperial




egg, large
1
1


lemon juice
15 g
1-1/2 Tbsp


dijon mustard
5 g
1 tsp


garlic1, minced
1
1


oil2
225 g
1 c


salt
pinch
pinch



1 optional2 vegetable or canola

title: Mayo
text:
Process

Step A | Prep

Add to a jar3, in order

egg
lemon juice
mustard
garlic, optional

Pour oil on top of jar mixture

allow to settle for 15 sec


3 should closely fits the head of the immersion blender

Step B | Blend

Place head of immersion blender on top of egg yolk at bottom on jar
Blend on high speed

do not pulse or move the head of immersion blender
slowly lift the head until all oil is emulsified




Step C | Season

Season to taste with salt

title: Mayo
text:
Documentation

It is imperative that the jar you use be just slightly larger than the head of the immersion blender, and the egg/lemon mixture must be in contact with the blades of the blender before you switch it on for this to work. The head of the blender must be firmly planted against the bottom of the jar until the mayonnaise starts to come together. If you can’t find a jar the right size, double the recipe in order to increase the starting volume of the egg/lemon mixture.
If your mayonnaise is watery, that means it has not emulsified properly. Let the mixture settle and separate, then try blending again.

J. Kenji López-Alt
